channel.title: TravelCommons
channel.description: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination
channel.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
channel.itunes:summary: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination

item.title: My Top 13 Tips to Survive Travel Chaos
item.description:
Back behind the microphone after a couple of months of setting up the new studios in Nashville. I've been dishing out travel advice to friends and family swept up in this summer's travel chaos. I've distilled all those texts and messages down to my top 13 travel tips to help those traveling through the rest of the year. We also talk about the countries that have dropped all of the COVID testing requirements for inbound passengers, noodle about the rationale for JetBlue's dogged pursuit of Spirit Airways, Delta's new time limits for their Sky Club lounges, and why frequent flier award travel is suddenly a bargain again.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: I've distilled my travel advice down to the top 13 travel tips to avoid the current chaos. Also, the scrapping of COVID travel test rules and why frequent flier award travel is a bargain again.
item.itunes:summary: I've distilled my travel advice down to the top 13 travel tips to avoid the current chaos. Also, the scrapping of COVID travel test rules and why frequent flier award travel is a bargain again.
item.itunes:keywords: Airport lounges, COVID travel rules, Delta Airlines, frequent flier awards, frequent flier programs, JetBlue, Spirit Airways, travel chaos, travel podcast, travel tips

item.title: Moving to a Non-Hub Airport; What Makes A Great Taproom?
item.description:
The last episode recording in Chicago before we relocate the TravelCommons studios, and our lives, down to Nashville. We close out our threads on in-flight mask mandates and hotel housekeeping, and critique an academic paper about the moral hazard of frequent flier elite status. I talk through the changes I’ll have to make when flying out of a non-hub airport. And then, as I’m making a list of the Chicago breweries I want to re-visit before leaving, I think through the characteristics that makes a taproom great.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: In-flight mask mandates; hotel housekeeping; moral hazard of frequent flier status; changes flying out of a non-hub airport; characteristics of a great taproom

item.title: Mask Mandate Scramble; Small Airport Survival
item.description:
We recap the bouncing ball history of the in-flight mask mandate as we try to figure out where it's going land now that it's in the courts. But before that, I recap my trip to Santa Fe, NM, take the flight tracking app Flighty for a spin, and wonder why CLEAR keeps giving away annual subscriptions. Then we dig into the current state of regional airports with Joanne Magley, of Daytona Beach International Airport

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Following the bouncing ball of on-flight mask mandates, my trip to Santa Fe, NM, reviewing flight tracking app Flighty, and Daytona Beach International Airport.
item.itunes:summary: Following the bouncing ball of on-flight mask mandates, my trip to Santa Fe, NM, reviewing flight tracking app Flighty, and Daytona Beach International Airport.
item.itunes:keywords: Airports, CDC, Clear, CLEAR registered traveler, Daytona Beach, Florida, In-Flight Masks, Masks, Regional Jets, Santa Fe, Small Airports, Southwest Airlines, Travel Apps, TSA, travel stories, travel tips, travel podcast

item.title: Notes on Louisville; Changing Mask Mandates
item.description:
As the great American philosopher Ferris Bueller once said, “Life moves pretty fast” and in this episode, we talk about the rapid changes in hotel service, and in-flight mask mandates. Then I go into detail about our recent trip to Louisville, complete with recommendations for food and drink

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.itunes:subtitle: The American philosopher Ferris Bueller said, “Life moves pretty fast” In this episode, we talk about rapid changes in hotel service and in-flight mask mandates. Then a trip report and recommendations from our trip to Louisville.

item.title: Figuring Out Stealth Travel Inflation
item.description:
In the travel world, what goes up -- rules, fees, prices -- often stays up. It's the ratchet effect and it's a theme running through this episode. Inflation is on everyone's mind, and so we dig into travel inflation, comparing today's prices with pre-pandemic levels. We also talk about US passport renewals ahead of the summer vacation season, and some good Cuban food in Louisville and a questionable food trend in London.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Analyzing travel inflation and ratcheting add-on fees; changing COVID test rules; renewing US passports; Louisville Cuban restaurant; COVID catches up to me

item.itunes:keywords: Add-On Fees, Baggage Fees, COVID test, COVID travel rules, inflation, Louisville, restaurants, Southwest Airlines, Travel Price Index, travel stories, travel tips, US Passport Renewal, travel podcast

item.title: COVID Test Anxiety; Michelin Dining Adventures
item.description:
No travel since the last episode, but lots of travel planning. Are we making our way back to pre-COVID travel planning patterns? Omicron has lots of people worried about testing positive and getting stuck abroad. Michael Giusti of InsuranceQuotes.com talks about how travel insurance can help. A blogger’s brutal review of a Michelin-starred restaurant where we ate in October gets me thinking about food as an adventure.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.itunes:subtitle: Travel planning trends; COVID test anxiety and how travel insurance helps; blogger’s brutal review of a restaurant gets me thinking about food as adventure

item.itunes:keywords: COVID test, Frequent Flyer Status, Michelin stars, Real ID, restaurants, Test Anxiety, Travel Insurance, travel planning, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips, USB-C, travel podcast

item.title: Yet More COVID Changes; Words That Mean Adventure
item.description:
Back in front of the microphone after a two-week trip to the UK, getting back home just before the new Omicron travel restrictions hit. We talk about getting to London, surfing the waves of changing travel requirements, a new way to renew Global Entry, moan a bit more about the inexorable advance of the cashless society, and finish up talking with Josh Glenn about his new book The Adventurer’s Glossary.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.title: Travel Potpourri for $600; 2021 Traveler’s Gift Guide
item.description:
No travel since the last episode, so just talking through a random potpourri of travel stuff. There's more travel planning; this time for a couple of weeks split between London and Wales which means sorting through a new set of COVID travel requirements. We look at some stats -- Uber's latest financials and how deeply last year's lockdown hit Nashville airport vendors. I marvel at how much European mobile data rates have fallen, strip down my English to have a deeper chat with an Italian bartender, and wrap it all up with highlights from this year's traveler's gift guide.

Check out this episode's show notes here and the 2021 Traveler's Gift Guide post here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.title: Tracking COVID Travel Requirements; Cycling Thru Puglia
item.description:
Back at the microphone after two weeks in Southern Italy. Lots of travel segments that could’ve gone wrong, but none of them did. We talk about what international travel is like in COVID times, about the challenge of keeping track and complying with the different COVID travel requirements that seem to be constantly changing, and then some thoughts about our bike tour through Puglia.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: What international travel is like in COVID times; tracking different country and regional COVID travel requirements that keep changing; cycling tour thru Puglia
item.itunes:summary: What international travel is like in COVID times; tracking different country and regional COVID travel requirements that keep changing; cycling tour thru Puglia
item.itunes:keywords: Air France, Alitalia, bicycling Tour, business travel, Catania, COVID travel rules, Global Entry, Italy, Puglia, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips, United Airlines, VPN, frequent traveler

item.title: High-Tech Airport Lines; Business Travel Still Missing
item.description:
Not much travel, but a lot of travel planning for our first post-lockdown international trip to Italy. Trying to thread our way through changing COVID rules and Alitalia’s bankruptcy throes. I’m getting inundated with discount offers for Clear’s fast-pass service. I’ve resisted them so far, because I remember back to when the first incarnation of Clear wanted to sell its members’ biometric data. We then talk to Xovis Technology‘s Cody Shulman about how airports are better managing all sorts of lines in airports. Finally, air passenger traffic is dropping again because business travelers are still MIA.

Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Planning our Italy trip around new COVID rules and Alitalia bankruptcy; airports managing lines with AI and high-tech sensors; business travelers still missing
item.itunes:summary: Planning our Italy trip around new COVID rules and Alitalia bankruptcy; airports managing lines with AI and high-tech sensors; business travelers still missing
item.itunes:keywords: Alitalia, business travel, CLEAR registered traveler, Global Entry, Italy, security lines, Southwest Airlines, travel planning, travel stories, travel tips, TSA, frequent traveler

item.title: What Remains from Pandemic Times; Best Restaurant and Bars
item.description:
Last month's travel got me wondering what travel changes are going to stick after the COVID pandemic begins to recede. With all the restaurant and bar closures caused by COVID lockdowns, I'm updating my recommendations list based on recent travels. And, I'm way overthinking our first post-lockdown international trip.

Check out this episode's show notes here and the blog post with my 2021 restaurant and bar recommendations here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)

item.title: B-Sides and Rarities
item.description:
After a 2-week, 2,500-mile driving expedition through the Northeast, there wasn't much time to write a new episode. So, I mined recent interviews for stories that got left on the cutting room floor. Also talk about COVID planning for a fall trip to Italy and mourn the demise of American Airlines’ in-flight magazine.

Check out this episode's show notes here

item.title: Looking Back Over Four Years of TravelCommons
item.description: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.itunes:summary: Recorded in the Seattle Marriott Waterfront, this special 4th-year anniversary edition collates the best bits from four years of TravelCommons podcasts. Starting with the "hotel medley" -- the roll call of all the hotels that have served as TravelCommons recording studios, we move on to excerpts from stories about the TSA, Bose headphones, memories of better airplane food, the hassles of travel, and some of the most entertaining sights I've seen in the last four years.
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: travel, business travel, travel stories, anniversary show
